com.github.fge.filesystem.attributes

Class FileAttributesFactory

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.github.fge.filesystem.attributes.FileAttributesFactory

  • @ParametersAreNonnullByDefault
public class FileAttributesFactory
extends Object
    File attributes factory

    This class allows you to register attribute providers and add implementations. You must provide one such factory per filesystem and at least provide an implementation of the basic file attributes, as required by the API.

    It is also responsible for generating instances of attribute provider classes at runtime (using MethodHandles).

    You must extend this class, provide the metadata class used when building attribute providers and then register your attribute provider classes using addImplementation(String, Class); you can even register your own attribute views using addDescriptor(AttributesDescriptor) (do this before registering implementations).

    See this pagefor a sample use.

    Unless otherwise noted, all methods of this class will throw a NullPointerException if a null argument is passed.

    See Also:
    FileSystemDriverBase

    • Method Detail

      • getDescriptors

        @Nonnull
public final Map<String,AttributesDescriptor> getDescriptors()
        Return a list of all attribute descriptors registered with this factory
        Returns:
        an immutable map (where keys are the names of the views and values are the descriptors themselves)

      • getProvider

        @Nullable
public final FileAttributesProvider getProvider(String name,
                                          Object metadata)
                                         throws IOException
        Instantiate a new provider for a given attribute view with the given metadata
        Parameters:
        name - the attribute view name
        metadata - the metadata to use to instantiate the provider
        Returns:
        the provider, or null if this view is not supported
        Throws:
        IOException - failed to generate the provider
        See Also:
        FileSystemDriverBase.readAttributes(Path, String, LinkOption...), FileSystemDriverBase.setAttribute(Path, String, Object, LinkOption...), MethodHandle.invoke(Object...)

      • getFileAttributeView

        @Nullable
public final <V extends FileAttributeView> V getFileAttributeView(Class<V> targetClass,
                                                            Object metadata)
                                                       throws IOException
        Generate an attribute provider implementing the target attribute view class

        Note that the returned target may not "strictly" implement the view; it may be a subclass of it. For instance, if you only have an implementation for DosFileAttributeView, this is what will be returned if you ask for a BasicFileAttributeView (since the former extends the latter).

        Type Parameters:
        V - type parameter of the target view
        Parameters:
        targetClass - the target view
        metadata - the metadata to generate the provider with
        Returns:
        a matching provider downcast to the given class, or null if this view is not supported
        Throws:
        IOException - failed to generate the attribute provider
        See Also:
        FileSystemDriverBase.getFileAttributeView(Path, Class, LinkOption...)

      • getFileAttributes

        @Nullable
public final <A extends BasicFileAttributes> A getFileAttributes(Class<A> targetClass,
                                                           Object metadata)
                                                      throws IOException
        Generate an attribute provider matching the target attributes class

        Note that the returned target may not "strictly" implement the attribute class; it may be a subclass of it. For instance, if you only have an implementation for DosFileAttributes, this is what will be returned if you ask for a BasicFileAttributes (since the former extends the latter).

        Type Parameters:
        A - type parameter of the target attribute class
        Parameters:
        targetClass - the target attribute class
        metadata - the metadata to generate the provider with
        Returns:
        a matching provider downcast to the given class, or null if this attribute class is not supported
        Throws:
        IOException - failed to generate the attribute provider
        See Also:
        FileSystemDriverBase.readAttributes(Path, Class, LinkOption...)

      • setMetadataClass

        protected final void setMetadataClass(Class<?> metadataClass)
        Set the metadata class used when constructing new attribute provider instances

        This method must be called before registering attribute provider implementations.

        Parameters:
        metadataClass - the class
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - a metadata class has already been set
        See Also:
        FileSystemDriver.getPathMetadata(Path)

      • addDescriptor

        protected final void addDescriptor(AttributesDescriptor descriptor)
        Add an attribute view descriptor
        Parameters:
        descriptor - the descriptor to add
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - a descriptor by that name is already registered
        See Also:
        AttributesDescriptor.getName()

      • addImplementation

        protected final void addImplementation(String name,
                     Class<? extends FileAttributesProvider> providerClass)
        Add an implementation for a given attribute view
        Parameters:
        name - the name of the view
        providerClass - the attribute provider class
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - no metadata class has been set, or no descriptor associated with that view
        InvalidAttributeProviderException - provided class is not a concrete class; or no suitable constructor has been found; or it is not a subclass of the associated view class and (if any) attribute class
        See Also:
        AttributesDescriptor.getViewClass(), AttributesDescriptor.getAttributeClass()
